parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To sympathize with, have compassion on. From sumpathes; to feel 'sympathy' with, i.e. to commiserate.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
One bound, a prisoner. From desmon; a captive.
Joy, gladness, a source of joy. From chairo; cheerfulness, i.e. Calm delight.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 2nd Person Plural
str2: From pros and dechomai; to admit (figuratively) endurance); by implication, to await.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
The act of plundering; plunder, spoil, robbery. From harpazo; pillage.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Genitive Neuter Plural
str2: To begin, am, exist, be in possession. From hupo and archomai; to begin under, i.e. Come into existence; expletively, to exist (verb).

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: A prolonged form of a primary verb; to 'know' in a great variety of applications and with many implications.

parse: Reflexive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Plural

str2: To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.
Stronger, more excellent. Comparative of a derivative of kratos; stronger, i.e. better, i.e. Nobler.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Accusative Feminine Singular
str2: To remain, abide, stay, wait; with acc: I wait for, await. A primary verb; to stay.
Goods, substance, property, possessions. From huparcho; existency or proprietorship, i.e. property, wealth.
